title: Opening Ceremony of Omani Cultural Day Held In Rio de Janeiro
text:
Opening Ceremony of Omani Cultural Day Held In Rio de Janeiro
The opening ceremony of the Omani Cultural Day, in Rio de Janeiro, was held in France-Brazil House, under the patronage of Pedro Spadale, Deputy Minister for International Relations of the State of Rio de Janeiro.
The opening ceremony was held in the presence of Sheikh Hamad bin Hilal al-Ma’amari, Undersecretary of the Ministry of Heritage and Culture for Cultural Affairs, Hassan bin Mohammed al-Lawatia, Advisor to the Minister of Heritage and Culture, Dr. Khalid bin Said al Jaradi, the Sultanate’s Ambassador to the Federal Republic of Brazil and Dr. Mohammed al-Ma’amari, Scientific Advisor at the office of the Minister of Awqaf and Religious Affairs.
At the beginning of the ceremony, al-Jaradi gave a speech, during which he said that, organising the Omani cultural day in Brazil, coincides with the 450th anniversary of the establishment of the city of Rio de Janeiro.
He explained that the Omani cultural day highlights the Sultanate’s cultural and civilisational heritage, as well as its diverse tourism and cultural potentials.
On his turn, Deputy Minister for International Relations of the State of Rio de Janeiro said that, his country looks forward to expanding relations with the Sultanate, to cover the cultural and intellectual areas.
He affirmed that this occasion is a great opportunity for the Brazilian people to get familiarised with the Sultanate’s heritage and civilisation.
